questions.question_text:
Given the following scenario: You have a trained version of the Document Understanding Model with 1000 pages called v22.10.0.1. You have an evaluation dataset of 100 pages that gave a score of 0.72 for v22.10.0.1. The business team labeled 800 pages and they ask for an increment of the Model that would contain all 1000+800 pages.

What is the first recommended pipeline run configuration to create the new version?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
should train with minor version = 0

questions.question_text: For what purpose can data coming from human validation be used in AI Center?

choices.D: To keep track of the number of documents that require human validation.
choices.C: To keep track of corrections done on the extracted data.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Using Data Labeling with human in the loop
Data Labeling enables you to upload raw data, annotate text data in the labeling tool (for classification or entity recognition), and use the labeled data to train ML models. Apart from this, you can use data labeling for human validation on model outputs.

A common scenario is when you train an extractor or classifier model. When the model prediction falls below a set confidence threshold, that data can be sent to Action Center for human validation. The validated data can be used to retrain the model in order to improve confidence on subsequent model predictions.

https://docs.uipath.com/ai-center/automation-cloud/latest/user-guide/using-data-labeling-with-human-in-the-loop

Selected Answer: D
In my case it has always taken more than 15
correct answer is D. It can take upto 30 mins in general as per documentation.

ChatGPT answer is D

As of my last update, the typical Machine Learning model deployment process in UiPath AI Center usually takes more than 15 minutes (option D). However, deployment times can vary depending on factors such as the complexity of the model, the size of the dataset, and the configuration of the deployment environment.

questions.question_text: In which of the following scenarios is the Intelligent Keyword Classifier the only valid classifier?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
It has file splitting capabilities.

https://docs.uipath.com/document-understanding/standalone/2022.4/user-guide/document-classification-intelligent-keyword-classifier

choices.D: When the document types are not relatively easy to differentiate
choices.B: When the document types are relatively easy to differentiate and file splitting is not necessary
choices.A: When the document types are not relatively easy to differentiate or file splitting is not necessary
choices.C: When the document types are relatively easy to differentiate and file splitting is necessary
